ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine

TITLE.P: Establishment of a Panel of Individual External Experts to Provide Expertise in Agriculture, Food and Sustainability Systems

SHORT_DESCR.P: SFSI (Sustainable Food Systems Ireland) is a consortium of public bodies that are responsible for the agriculture (including aquaculture) and food sectors in Ireland.
The SFSI consortium members are:
• Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine (DAFM);
• Teagasc — The Agriculture and Food Development Authority;
• Food Safety Authority of Ireland;
• Bord Bia — The Irish Food Board;
• Enterprise Ireland.
All SFSI consortium members are contracting authorities in their own rights.
The DAFM (the ‘Contracting Authority’) is issuing this request to participate (‘RTP’) in a Dynamic Purchasing System (‘DPS’) on behalf of all SFSI consortium members.

Contracting Authority invites requests to participate from economic operators for appointment to a DPS for the provision of individual external experts to provide expertise in agriculture, food and sustainable systems.
SFSI (Sustainable Food Systems Ireland) is a consortium of public bodies that are responsible for the agriculture (including aquaculture) and food sectors in Ireland.
The SFSI consortium members are:
• Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine;
• Teagasc — The Agriculture and Food Development Authority;
• Food Safety Authority of Ireland;
• Bord Bia — The Irish Food Board;
• Enterprise Ireland.
All SFSI consortium members are contracting authorities in their own rights.

The Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine is an SFSI consortium member. The Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine (DAFM) (the ‘Contracting Authority’) is issuing this request to participate (‘RTP’) in a Dynamic Purchasing System (‘DPS’) on behalf of all SFSI consortium members.

Contracting Authority invites requests to participate from economic operators for appointment to a DPS for the provision of individual external experts to provide expertise in agriculture, food and sustainable systems.
